meanings: [동사] collapse, (무게·압력 등으로) give way, (지붕 등이) cave in
be on the brink of ruin

examples.korean: The regime finally collapsed after 25 years of misrule. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 정권은 마침내 25년 간의 실정 끝에 붕괴되었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The regime finally collapsed after 25 years of misrule. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: The authority of the central government was rapidly disintegrating. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 중앙 정부의 권위는 급속히 붕괴되고 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The authority of the central government was rapidly disintegrating. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: The walls were strengthened to protect them from collapse. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 담들이 붕괴되는 것을 방지하기 위해 보강 공사를 했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The walls were strengthened to protect them from collapse. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Rescuers used props to stop the roof of the tunnel collapsing. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 구조대원들이 터널 지붕의 붕괴를 막기 위해 지주를 이용했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Rescuers used props to stop the roof of the tunnel collapsing. Add to Wordbook
